content:
Dear all,

I am happy to announce our #ICRA 2022 workshop “Compositional Robotics: Mathematics and Tools”.

The workshop will feature an introduction to mathematical principles and practical tools for compositional robotics, as well as research talks.

If you are interested, join the official mailing list: http://eepurl.com/hQFTeP

You can find the detailed program of the workshop at the official webpage https://idsc.ethz.ch/research-frazzoli/workshops/compositional-robotics-2022.html

Furthermore, we officially released a call for papers related to the workshop, available at https://easychair.org/cfp/ICRA2022CRMT (deadline for submissions May 8, 2022).
Accepted submissions will have the chance to present at the workshop.

Thanks to the great team of co-organizers @Andrea Censi , @Jonathan Lorand , Emilio Frazzoli, @David Spivak, @Brendan Fong, @Paolo Perrone, @John Baez, Dylan Shell, Alexandra Nilles, Andrew Spielberg, Anne Collin, Matthew Kvalheim, Paul Gustafson, Daniel Koditschek, Aaron Ames
(To save people a search: the workshop dates are May 23-27, and the location is Philadelphia with plans to have it hybrid)
Yes, thx Matteo! The workshop might happen on the 23rd or on the 27th, not confirmed yet. Both in case of a hybrid and a fully live workshop we will record talks and publish them as last year.
You know coronavirus has set in when people don't even bother saying where a conference is anymore.

Regarding this, we now officially opened the call for papers: https://easychair.org/cfp/ICRA2022CRMT

Note that both extended abstracts (max. 2 pages) and already published/under review works are welcome. Accepted submissions will be given a spot for an oral presentation at the workshop. @Georgios Bakirtzis @Vincent Wang
Is there any word on when the videos from this will be up?
I'm on the organizing committee and I haven't gotten any emails about that question.

Hi all,

Does anyone know if the videos from the 2021 meeting are still available? The links at the meeting website seem to have rotted :big_frown:.

Maybe @Andrea Censi or @Gioele Zardini can help?
The 2022 wasn't recorded unfortunately. But 2021 are here: https://vimeo.com/andreacensi
